title: Drawing, Page of a sketchbook; Heavenly powers helping pious; Sketch for potrait of saint; Decoration of pediment, ca. 1590
title_raw: Page of a sketchbook; Heavenly powers helping pious; Sketch for potrait of saint; Decoration of pediment
medium: Bistre, pen and ink, wash on paper
inscribed: Verso, at left: Padre figliolo e maria / spiritu sante; Low right corner: la carte / uno angele in mane; Caption: malata linferno e el paradiso e santi / diaveli fugano e purgatorio langeli / recomandino lanima a dio; Above this at right: 2; Caption: in transito diavoli in torno delle angeli / recevano lanima paradiso celeste modona / gioà[nni] e sante confessore con la candela in / mano dame piangano crucifisse; Center top: 4
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Horizontal rectangle. Verso, at left side: St. Anthony Hermit, with Tan cross and bell, stands at the right of the bed. Hell is represented in front of the bed. At left are two flying angels and a third person, fragmentary, covering the dying person. The upper one of the angels holds a scroll. Above, at right, the bands of Christ, God the Father, and Mary. The Dove flies before God the Father. Written beside, at left: "Padre figliolo e maria / spiritu sante." Written in the low right corner: "la carte / uno angele in mane." Caption: "malata linferno e el paradiso e santi / diaveli fugano e purgatorio langeli / recomandino lanima a dio." "2" is written above, ar right. Seprated by a strip at right. A monk with two crying women kneeling beside him. Devils are at right. Angels to the left of the soul of the dead person. A Cavalry group is shown at left. Caption: "in transito diavoli in torno delle angeli / recevano lanima paradiso celeste modona / gioà[nni] e sante confessore con la candela in / mano dame piangano crucifisse." "4" is written in the center top. Recto: in opposite direction, at right: An ovoidal bust portrait of a saint is in the center. At left, vertically: a bracket with a fire bowl is in the central motif; it is flanked by dolphins. An alternative suggestion for the bowl is above, at right.

participants.person_name: Jan van der Straet, called Stradanus

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Page of a sketchbook; Heavenly powers helping pious; Sketch for potrait of saint; Decoration of pediment, ca. 1590. Bistre, pen and ink, wash on paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2644
